meanings.definition: A poster or program advertising a theatrical performance.
meanings.sent1: The playbills outside the theater showed the upcoming shows.
meanings.sent2: I collected all the playbills from the musicals I watched.
meanings.sent3: The playbills were so colorful, they looked like mini rainbow posters.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with playbills, turning it into a theater of memories.
meanings.sent5: The playbills fluttered in the wind, drawing in the audience with their vibrant designs.

meanings.definition: To distribute or display playbills for a show.
meanings.sent1: She playbills the streets before the play to attract more viewers.
meanings.sent2: The theater staff playbills the lobby with posters for the new play.
meanings.sent3: He playbills with such enthusiasm that even the passersby stop to read.
meanings.sent4: The actors playbills the town, spreading excitement for their upcoming performance.
meanings.sent5: As the sun sets, they playbills the area, preparing for the night's show.
